summary: The Wassenaar Arrangement is an intergovernmental agreement that facilitates the exchange of information and promotes transparency in the transfer of conventional arms and dual-use goods and technologies. Established in 1996, it aims to enhance global security and prevent destabilizing accumulations of arms. Within the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, the Wassenaar Arrangement influences member statesâ€™ export control policies, ensuring compliance with international standards. The EU aligns its regulations with the principles of the Arrangement, fostering cooperation among nations to mitigate risks associated with arms proliferation and to uphold international peace and security.
